byline.contributor: Nate Cohn contributed reporting from Washington, and Nick Corasaniti from Cushing, Iowa.
byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and TRIP GABRIEL

abstract: Republican presidential primary contender Carly Fiorina challenges Republican National Committee and CNN to secure a place among the 10 candidates to be chosen for the second Republican presidential debate in September; Fiorina campaign charges criteria for the selection of candidates does not fully reflect her significant gains in recent national polls.
lead_paragraph: Carly Fiorina, the former Hewlett-Packard executive, wants to be on the main stage at the event, and she is waging a public war with CNN and the Republican National Committee.

headline.main: Carly Fiorina, Gaining in Polls, Moves to Secure Spot in 2nd G.O.P. Debate
headline.print_headline: Fiorina, Gaining in Polls, Moves to Secure Spot in Second G.O.P. Debate

snippet: Carly Fiorina, the former Hewlett-Packard executive, wants to be on the main stage at the event, and she is waging a public war with CNN and the Republican National Committee.
